description: Smallest positive a(n) such that number of solutions to a(n)=a(j)+a(k) j<k<n is three or less.
comments: Numbers {1,3,8,10} mod 11 plus {2,4,5,6,7,16}. Note that while the cases for "zero", "one", "two" and "four" essentially involve a third of the natural numbers, this case for "three" involves 4/11.
example: 12 is in the sequence since it is 5+7, 4+8 and 2+10 but no other sum of two distinct terms.
mathematica: f[s_List, j_Integer] := Block[{cnt, k = s[[-1]] + 1, ss = Plus @@@ Subsets[s, {j}]}, While[ cnt = Count[ss, k]; cnt == 0 || cnt > 3, k++]; Append[s, k]]; Nest[f[#, 2] &, {1, 2}, 70] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 05 2014 *)
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Mar 15 2001
